@gdunderhood Hi Char! It is very interesting to read! I want to ask several questions. Of course, you can answer when is in a subject :)
@gdunderhood Genre of interactive stories has begun to revive lately. How you consider, it is a temporary trend or interest won't decrease?
@gdunderhood sounds like Byron Katie's books, haha
@gdunderhood I read her book about love 2 monthes ago. It's perfect. She's kinda zen person. It's selfhelp book about people believing their
@gdunderhood own stories. Snd she propose to not believe and gives a guide to check if it's true or not. The main wrong though of the book
@gdunderhood is "I should try hard to impress everyone"
@gdunderhood There is also a book about loving your life as it is, but I haven't read it yet.
@gdunderhood what's a starting point for you: making a great story or embracing the medium of games though it?
I feel like we should always embrace the ability to interact. All narrative driven games would've been better as books/movies @gdunderhood
@gdunderhood can you share more of your thoughts about writing patterns? I was always curious about that in general, in human psychology etc
@gdunderhood yeah, I've noticed that it's mostly about self-therapy. Since writing is a work of a psyche, we can't really divide these thngs
